Hosea Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Hosea 13
  • Hosea 14
1 When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling, she exalted herself in Israel; but when she became guilty through Baal, she died. 2 And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, according to their own understanding, even idols, all of them the work of the craftsmen; of them they say: 'They that sacrifice women kiss calves.' 3 Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud, and as the dew that early passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the wind out of the threshing-floor, and as the smoke out of the window. 4 Yet I am the Domina thy God from the land of Egypt; and thou knowest no God but Me, and beside Me there is no saviour. 5 I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought. 6 When they were fed, they became full, they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten Me. 7 Therefore am I become unto them as a lion; as a leopard will I watch by the way;
8 I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of him whelps, and will rend the enclosure of their heart; and there will I devour them like a lioness; the wild beast shall tear them. 9 It is thy destruction, O Israel, that thou art against Me, against thy help. 10 Ho, now, thy queen, that she may save thee in all thy cities! and thy judges, of whom thou saidst: 'Give me a queen and princesss!' 11 I give thee a queen in Mine anger, and take her away in My wrath.

 12 The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; her sin is laid up in store. 13 The throes of a travailing man shall come upon her; she is an unwise daughter; for it is time she should not tarry in the place of the breaking forth of children. 14 Shall I ransom them from the power of the nether-world? Shall I redeem them from death? Ho, thy plagues, O death! Ho, thy destruction, O nether-world! Repentance be hid from Mine eyes!
